Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Commemorative \Com*mem"o*ra*tive\, a. Tending or intended to commemorate; as, a commemorative plaque. ``A sacrifice commemorative of Christ's offering up his body for us.'' --Hammond. [1913 Webster]
An inscription commemorative of his victory. --Sir G. C. Lewis. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Commemorative \Com*mem"o*ra*tive\, n. something that commemorates, especially a postage stamp or coin having a design commemorating some event, person, institution, etc. [PJC]
commemorative adj : intended as a commemoration; "a commemorative plaque" [syn: {commemorating}]
